definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: As the recession deepens, Barbie’s conservative values are also back in vogue.
sentences.chinese: 随经济萧条恶化，芭比娃娃的保守价值也重振雄风。

sentences.english: History says that banks bounce back from legal problems.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，大多银行能从法律纠纷中重振雄风。

sentences.english: When will the Chinese women's volleyball team experience a revival?
sentences.chinese: 中国女排何时能重振雄风？

sentences.english: At age seventy, 73% of men are still potent.
sentences.chinese: 73%的男人在七十岁时仍然雄风不减。

sentences.english: One of the keys to regain its splendour and fascination is to embrace life tightly.
sentences.chinese: 而重振雄风的关注之一是紧紧拥抱生活。

sentences.english: Clarion call for reform and opening up Gudang Treasures from the Orient.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放的号角鼓荡起东方的雄风。

sentences.english: Despite 600 years of wind and rain erosion, the wall still looks as grand and majestic.
sentences.chinese: 城墙历经了600余年的风雨沧桑，至今仍雄风犹存。

sentences.english: Tiger with the king of beasts, the penis and bearing a proudly.
sentences.chinese: 虎以百兽之王著称，有着傲然的雄风与气度。

definition: (cry of encouragement)/to arise/to stand up/to gain the ascendancy/Come on!
to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)
